heroTitle: Free Polla Futbolera — Football Prediction Pool
heroSubtitle: Set up your football prediction pool in minutes, invite your friends and compete with match forecasts. Free, no real money, no hassle.
section1P1: In Colombia, Chile and Venezuela, every time a major football tournament kicks off the same question pops up in offices, WhatsApp groups and family gatherings: "have you joined the polla yet?". A polla futbolera is a prediction game where each participant forecasts match scores and earns points based on accuracy. At the end of the tournament, whoever has the most points earns the group's bragging rights — and the privilege of reminding everyone about it until the next edition.
section1P2: You don't need to be a sports analyst or a statistics expert to play. The beauty of the polla deportiva is precisely that: the person who never watches football can beat the lifelong fanatic. It's a game of intuition, gut feelings, of "I just feel the home team wins 2-0 today". That's what makes it so fun and so addictive.
section1P3: The word polla traces its roots to the Polla Chilena de Beneficencia, an institution founded in 1934 that organized collective draws for social causes. Over the decades, the term spread throughout the Andean and Caribbean region until it became the natural way to refer to any prediction game among friends. When the tournament in question is a World Cup, the tradition transforms into the famous polla mundialista: a social phenomenon that moves millions of people from Bogota to Valparaiso, from Caracas to Barranquilla.
section1P4: In other Latin American countries, the same game goes by different names: quiniela in Mexico, penca in Uruguay and Brazil, prode in Argentina, porra in Spain. But in Colombia, Chile and Venezuela, the word is polla — no discussion. It's part of everyday language: "the office polla", "the World Cup polla", "join the polla we set up". Where there's football, there's a polla.

pullQuote: "The polla futbolera is more than predictions and points — it's that Monday morning conversation at the office, the midnight message when a result saved your week, the friendly rivalry with your best friend who swears they know more about football than you. closingP1: The polla has something that no fantasy sports app or prediction house can replicate: the personal factor.
